vehiclesimulation
Class Terrain

java.lang.Object
  vehiclesimulation.Terrain
public class Terrain
extends java.lang.Object

Title: Vehicle Dynamics Simulation Program

Description: vehicle dynmaics, braking system simulation

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2006 Faculty of Information Technology Engineering at Damascus University

Terrain class holds multiple runtime created worlds, environments, for more realistic simulation.

one terrain is loaded on demand from model file, and others are programatically generated the Grid terrain is a line cross grid with 1 meter distance between each line

currently terrain is a land, with few sample roads generated in 3dmax

terrain without textures is also provided for possible performance issues on some machines

all methods are static, since the sole role of this class is the generation of such objects

Constructor Summary
Terrain()
           
 
Method Summary
static javax.media.j3d.TransformGroup generateGrid(int steps, int distance)
          grid for the emulation of movement counts should be even values, distance between lines is specified steps defines how many vertical or horiontal lines exists
static javax.media.j3d.TransformGroup generateTerrain1()
          load worlds into scene: terrain1 is a sample land scene with few sample streets textured proberly for a good visualiation.
static javax.media.j3d.TransformGroup generateTerrain1NoTextures()
          for performance considerations the same previous terrain is loaded but without texures
static javax.media.j3d.TransformGroup generateTrees()
          one transform group to hold all transform groups of all threes each tree consists of a stim which is a solid object, can be used in collision and branches which are one or more transparent textures and connected to a billboard a branch has two TGs one for translation and another to apply the billboard onto(rotation) the stim is a solid geomerty and thus requires no billborading, that's why they exist in a separate file this method is loader specific: here we use the Loader3DS from starfire, which uses this as we saw: we get TransformGroup by the method Loader3DS.getModel(), this TG contains one BranchGroup which consists of a TG for each single object in the file, each TG has a child of Shape3D

Method Detail

generateGrid

public static javax.media.j3d.TransformGroup generateGrid(int steps,
                                                          int distance)
grid for the emulation of movement counts should be even values, distance between lines is specified steps defines how many vertical or horiontal lines exists

Parameters:
steps - int number of lines(horizontal or vertical)
distance - int distance between two grid lines
Returns:
TransformGroup put it all in one transform group

generateTerrain1

public static javax.media.j3d.TransformGroup generateTerrain1()
load worlds into scene: terrain1 is a sample land scene with few sample streets textured proberly for a good visualiation.

later if possible the world will be spheral and some conversion function will be inserted to adapt without changing previous code, for now the land is simple horizonatl and large enough

generateTerrain1NoTextures

public static javax.media.j3d.TransformGroup generateTerrain1NoTextures()
for performance considerations the same previous terrain is loaded but without texures

generateTrees

public static javax.media.j3d.TransformGroup generateTrees()
one transform group to hold all transform groups of all threes each tree consists of a stim which is a solid object, can be used in collision and branches which are one or more transparent textures and connected to a billboard a branch has two TGs one for translation and another to apply the billboard onto(rotation)

the stim is a solid geomerty and thus requires no billborading, that's why they exist in a separate file

this method is loader specific: here we use the Loader3DS from starfire, which uses this as we saw: we get TransformGroup by the method Loader3DS.getModel(), this TG contains one BranchGroup which consists of a TG for each single object in the file, each TG has a child of Shape3D

Returns:
TransformGroup
